SEARCH
Package com.logic.api

Interface IFOLExp

public interface IFOLExp
The IFOLExp interface represents a first-order logic expression. This interface provides methods to iterate over various components of a first-order logic expression, such as functions, predicates, bounded variables, unbounded variables, and to check whether the expression is a sentence or contains free variables. An instance of IFOLExp can represent any first-order logic expression, which may include:
  • Functions
  • Predicates
  • Bounded variables (quantified variables)
  • Unbounded variables (free variables)
  • Sentences (logical expressions with no free variables)

The methods in this interface allow for working with first-order logic expressions, such as determining the set of bounded and unbounded variables, checking if a variable is bounded, and verifying whether an expression is a sentence (i.e., has no free variables).

Since:
08-03-2025

    Method

    isABoundedVariable (String variable)
    Checks if a given variable is a bounded variable in this first-order logic expression.

  • Method Details

    • iterateFunctions

      Iterator<String> iterateFunctions()
      Iterates through all the function names used in the first-order logic expression. A function is typically a mapping from a set of terms to another term, such as "f(x)" or "g(a, b)".
      Returns:
      An iterator over the functions in this expression.

    • iteratePredicates

      Iterator<String> iteratePredicates()
      Iterates through all the predicate names used in the first-order logic expression. A predicate is a relation between terms, such as "P(x)" or "Father(x, y)".
      Returns:
      An iterator over the predicates in this expression.

    • iterateBoundedVariables

      Iterator<String> iterateBoundedVariables()
      Iterates through all the bounded variables in the first-order logic expression. A bounded variable is a variable that is within the scope of a quantifier (e.g., "∀x" or "∃y").
      Returns:
      An iterator over the bounded variables in this expression.

    • isABoundedVariable

      boolean isABoundedVariable (String variable)
      Checks if a given variable is a bounded variable in this first-order logic expression. A bounded variable is one that is part of a quantifier's scope.
      Parameters:
      variable - The variable to check.
      Returns:
      true if the variable is bounded, false otherwise.

    • iterateUnboundedVariables

      Iterator<String> iterateUnboundedVariables()
      Iterates through all the unbounded variables in the first-order logic expression. An unbounded (or free) variable is one that is not part of any quantifier's scope.
      Returns:
      An iterator over the unbounded variables in this expression.

    • isASentence

      boolean isASentence()
      Checks if this first-order logic expression is a sentence. A sentence is a formula that contains no free (unbounded) variables.
      Returns:
      true if the expression is a sentence, false if it contains free variables.
